byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT
byline.contributor: Omar al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad, an employee of The New York Times from Mosul, Iraq, and Steven Lee Myers from Dushanbe, Tajikistan.

abstract: News analysis; Pres Obama announces that beyond the final withdrawal of troops, United States is scaling back plans for diplomatic, economic and cultural programs in Iraq because of fiscal and security concerns.
snippet: America’s fiscal troubles are dictating a drastic scaling back of plans to expand diplomatic, economic and cultural programs once deemed vital to steadying Iraq.
lead_paragraph: America’s fiscal troubles are dictating a drastic scaling back of plans to expand diplomatic, economic and cultural programs once deemed vital to steadying Iraq.

headline.main: U.S. Scales Back Diplomacy in Iraq Amid Fiscal and Security Concerns
headline.print_headline: U.S. Scales Back Diplomacy in Iraq Amid Fiscal and Security Concerns
